title: Blended Elementary Mathematics Course Design Utilizing Online Social Constructivism

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding elementary mathematics basic concepts and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: An environment where learners from medical, legal, and technical fields primarily use smartphones for asynchronous interactions combined with weekly offline collaboration

learning_goals: Learners share elementary math problem-solving strategies with peers through purposeful interpersonal interaction (PII) and achieve over 80% participation.
Learners generate and reflect on feedback for mathematical concept explanations three or more times in online discussions based on social constructivist principles.
Learners complete collaborative projects using PII in a blended learning environment and achieve satisfaction ratings of 4 or higher (5-point scale) through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
